bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Illness Sign identical with fu da 腹大 , abdominal enlargement. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry qiu shi 秋石 quotes SYL : 有人病顛腹鼓，日久加喘滿，垂困，亦服此而安也 , “If someone suffers from peak[-illness] and abdominal drum , to which after an extended period are added panting and a feeling of fullness, as well as difficulties to sleep, have him ingest this also, and he will be calmed down”. Fu gu ju 附骨疽 , bone-attached impediment - illness [10]

Pathological Condition of ju 疽 , impediment-illness, developing at a depth close to the bones. Skin and flesh tissue at the affected location are tense and painful, and there is only a small chance of festering towards the outside. Movement is incapacitated. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 22: 凡附骨疽者，以其無破，附骨成膿，故名附骨疽 , “As for all impediment - illnesses that are attached to a bone, because they do not break and develop pus while they are attached to a bone they are called ‘ bone-attached impediment - illnesses ’”.
